title: How singing helped me to find my voice again after my husband died
text:
When it comes to bereavement, saying that time will heal is ­misleading. Because as any bereaved person knows, there is no real healing. The void left will ­always be gaping and painful.

There is however, huge potential for coming to terms with grief and learning to live with it.

In February 2016, my husband of 30 years, Bob, died suddenly, with no warning. He’d had a slight cold and at dinner that evening, I noticed that he was flushed. I teased him about it, saying it only added to his rugged good looks. He was slim, fit, quick-witted, funny – it never occurred to me that I had any reason to worry.
